sentence.Network_en: The food at the hotel was barely edible.
sentence.Network_cn: 这家旅馆的食物简直不能入口。

sentence.Network_en: Edible wild herbs kept us from dying of starvation.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们靠着野菜才没被饿死.

sentence.Network_en: This kind of mushroom is edible, but that kind is not.
sentence.Network_cn: 这种蘑菇吃得, 那种吃不得.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: from late Latin edibilis, from Latin edere 'eat'

entry.def: If something is edible, it is safe to eat and not poisonous.

means.word_mean: 1. any substance that can be used as food

stems_affixes.value_cn: 不适于食用的, 不能吃的
stems_affixes.word_buile: in不+edible[adj.可食用的]→adj.不适于食用的, 不能吃的
obey[v.服从, 顺从]+ience=ence状态→obedience服众, 顺从

Sentence.sentence: Major supermarkets, in meeting consumer expectations, will often reject entire crops of perfectly edible fruit and vegetables at the farm because they do not meet exacting marketing standards for their physical characteristics, such as size and appearance.

means.word_mean: 可以吃的, 可食用的,适宜食用的,（无毒而）可以吃的

sentences.en: Take some edible food when you go there.

jushi.english: Take some edible food when you go there.
This kind of fruit is not edible for human, it's poisonous.
jushi.chinese: 这种水果有毒,人不能吃。
